title: What types of images do old people keep on their phones? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have a lot of a calico cat and some tabby cats. The tabbies are my boyfriend’s cats. The calico cat is a neighborhood cat who has invited herself into my house couple of times. She came when I said kitty and looked over my house climbed everywhere had a snack and left. I had seen her on my fence before and across the street. Three days later she was on my lawn and I looked out the window, she saw me and came to the door she came in and out 4 times in a hour got petted, rubbed my legs and left. She has been gone 10 days, I miss her, I don't have any cats but I do have lots of pictures of her.

Senior Boomer here. I don’t keep a lot of stuff on my smart phone - a contact list of phone numbers of course, a few photos, shortcuts to a some often used web sites, and some e-mail. That’s about it.
I can't speak for others but I have nature pictures. Some may have family, pets, nostalgic pictures.
I'm gonna go out on alimb here and say, the same things everyone has on their phones, email, messaging, photos, dictionary, thesaurus, shopping and game apps.
rotting skin.  BLT sandwich.  microwave piggy bank
Oh, I don't know. What was the question again?
